page.title: 183 BELLS OF KNOTT END
page.content: {St Bernard's Church}, Hackensall Road, was built in 1922. It is lovely. It has stained glass windows of bright colours and beautiful pictures and scenes from the bible. Opposite the altar on one wall is a big tapestry made of hessian and other materials. It shows Jesus with a lamb in his arms. The pews are in front of and at both sides of the altar and there are long windows looking out onto lawns and trees. Beside the church is a triangular grave where the last parish priest{Bernard Cochrane}was buried in 1984. On the wall above is a statue of Christ and above it is the Aramaic word "Maranatha" meaning "The Lord is near".On another wall are three silver bells, put there when Pope John Paul visited England in 1982.The bells are named{Mary Holland ,Pope John Paul}and { Barney}, Fr Bernard's dog that died.
